page.title: 01REVIEW OF THE BLOCK.
page.content: The block covers the west side of York which takes in a small part of the historic walled city,including the Yorkshire Museum and Micklegate Bar.Most of the area is covered by housing,some private and some on large council estates. The River Ouse cuts across the block in the NE corner,crossed by Lendal Bridge on the line of the City Walls and by Clifton Bridge.To the south of the river are York Station and the carriage works.The railway covers a lot of ground and employs lots of people.York is an important station on the East Coast Line between London and Edinburgh. There are areas of open ground in the block;the Knavesmire,home of York Races and the site of Tyburn Gallows where Dick Turpin was hanged,in the south and Clifton Ings in the north.
